overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting hourly LUFL data with limited historical points. It begins by assessing data characteristics (no missing values, daily seasonality) and evaluates multiple modeling options before selecting a robust heuristic method. The approach prioritizes outlier resistance and simplicity given the short data history, leading to a median-based seasonal naive forecast implementation.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in historical data
key_insights: Short data length (96 points) necessitates simple, robust methods to avoid overfitting
Median-based aggregation provides resilience against outliers compared to mean
Explicit handling of datetime alignment for multi-day forecasting
Data rounding (3 decimals) to maintain input format consistency
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough evaluation of statistical methods (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) before implementing a carefully justified heuristic solution. Includes detailed data pattern analysis and step-by-step computational validation.
